pull.title: Fix issues in ZMQ error handling
pull.body: Behaves better if abnormal issues occur

events.message:
Bugfix: ZMQ: Leave notifiers intact rather than shut them down if they fail a notification once

Whatever the cause of the failure, it makes more sense to keep trying rather than kill the notifier entirely
Bugfix: ZMQ: Don't try to use zmq_strerror when reading block from disk fails
ZMQ: If reading block from disk fails, log the block hash

events.body:

### Conflicts
No conflicts as of last run.

> Behaves better if abnormal issues occur

Can you elaborate at all? I assume this is something that occured in production?

cc @instagibbs. Might be interested in reviewing?
Can be marked as draft, while it is waiting on the author?

<!--2e250dc3d92b2c9115b66051148d6e47-->
🤔 There hasn't been much activity lately and the CI seems to be failing.

If no one reviewed the current pull request by commit hash, a [rebase](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#rebasing-changes) can be considered. While the CI failure may be a false positive, the CI hasn't been running for some time, so there may be a real issue hiding as well. A rebase triggers the latest CI and makes sure that no silent merge conflicts have snuck in.

The PR didn't seem to attract much attention in the past. Also, the issue seems not important enough right now to keep it sitting around idle in the list of open PRs.

Closing due to lack of interest.
